_comment: Example MCP server configuration for Cursor IDE
_description: This file shows how to configure the Itok MCP server in Cursor. Copy the relevant section to your Cursor MCP settings.

itok._description: Itok MCP server for intelligent tokenization optimization
itok._note: Choose one of the following transport methods:

_option1_http.description: HTTP transport (recommended for development and debugging)
_option1_http._note: Requires the server to be running. Use 'npm start' or 'npm run dev' to start the server.

_option2_stdio.description: Stdio transport (for production or when running as a process)
_option2_stdio._note: Replace '/absolute/path/to/itok' with the actual path to your Itok project directory.

_instructions: 2. Navigate to Features > Model Context Protocol (or search for 'MCP')
3. Add the 'itok' server configuration using one of the options above
5. Verify connection by using the 'ping' tool in Cursor Composer Agent

_troubleshooting.server_not_responding: Ensure the server is running: 'npm start' or 'npm run dev'
_troubleshooting.connection_refused: Check that the port (default 3000) matches your server configuration
_troubleshooting.tools_not_appearing: Restart Cursor after adding the MCP configuration
